articles.author: Chris DeMars
articles.description:
This is the 3rd post in a small series we did on form accessibility. If you missed the second post, check out “Managing User Focus with :focus-visible“. In this post we are going to look at using a …
Demystifying Screen Readers: Accessible Forms & Best Practices originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Demystifying Screen Readers: Accessible Forms & Best Practices

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: In this comprehensive guide, Temani Afif explores different techniques for creating common shapes with the smallest and most flexible code possible.
articles.title: The Modern Guide For Making CSS Shapes

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Lazar Nikolov)
articles.description: React Server Components (RSCs) combine the best of client-side rendering, and author Lazar Nikolov thoroughly examines how we got here with a deep look at the impact that RSCs have on the page load timeline.
articles.title: The Forensics Of React Server Components (RSCs)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How do we conduct UX research when there is no or only limited access to users? Here are some workarounds to run UX research or make a strong case for it. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: How To Run UX Research Without Access To Users

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eduard Kuric)
articles.description: In this article, Eduard Kuric discusses mouse interaction data, what kind of magic can be done with it, and some of the hidden pitfalls to watch out for so you get a head start incorporating them in your solutions.
articles.title: How To Harness Mouse Interaction Data For Practical Machine Learning Solutions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Amit Sheen)
articles.description: Amit Sheen demonstrates using `:has()` to apply styles conditionally when a certain `` in a `` element is chosen by the user and how we gain even more conditional styling capabilities when chaining `:has()` with other pseudo-classes, such as `:not()` — no JavaScript necessary.
articles.title: Combining CSS :has() And HTML <select> For Greater Conditional Styling

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: May is almost here, so what better occasion could there be for some fresh and inspiring desktop wallpapers? Created with love by artists and designers from across the globe, the wallpapers in this post come in versions with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: Longing For May (2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yaakov Karda)
articles.description: Business acquisitions are common but often shrouded in mystery because they happen behind closed doors. In this article, Yaakov details the story of his company and the journey it took him on, shedding light on the process of selling a business and what he learned from the experience.
articles.title: Lessons Learned After Selling My Startup

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: Free-tier pricing is a common marketing strategy. “Free” gets people in the door and allows them to settle in and see how things work. But, as Juan Diego Rodriguez explains, the practice of free *tiers* is often conflated with free *trials*. And while the distinction may be nuanced, the consequences of sunsetting free-tier pricing may be huge.
articles.title: The End Of The Free Tier

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michele Williams)
articles.description: Conducting UX research that includes participants with a variety of disabilities is vital to building inclusive technology, but most prototypes used for testing are inaccessible. Rather than continuing to leave out feedback from disabled consumers, which ultimately leads to exclusive technology, researchers must get creative in their workarounds and be relentless in their efforts.
articles.title: Conducting Accessibility Research In An Inaccessible Ecosystem

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Pratik Joglekar)
articles.description: This article illustrates how AI can be leveraged to build tools that can be inclusive with a little bit of an additional effort.
articles.title: Using AI For Neurodiversity And Building Inclusive Tools

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Scrolling, scanning, skipping: How do users consume content online? Here’s what you need to know about reading behavior and design strategies to prevent harmful scanning patterns. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: F-Shape Pattern And How Users Read

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: What options do we have for integrating GraphQL with WordPress in 2024? Leonardo Losoviz describes the developments that have taken place in this space over the last three years.
articles.title: How To Work With GraphQL In WordPress In 2024

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alexis Kypridemos)
articles.description: What do you do when you need to convert plain text into formatted HTML? Perhaps you reach for Markdown or manually write in the element tags yourself. Or maybe you have one or two of the dozens of online tools that will do it for you. In this tutorial, Alexis Kypridemos picks those tools apart and details the steps for how we can do it ourselves with a little vanilla HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
articles.title: Converting Plain Text To Encoded HTML With Vanilla JavaScript

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Matt Zeunert)
articles.description: The three Core Web Vitals metrics don’t only tell you how visitors experience your website but also impact your Google search result rankings. In this article, we’ll look at what Core Web Vitals are, how they are measured, and how you can use DebugBear to monitor them continuously.
articles.title: How To Monitor And Optimize Google Core Web Vitals

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: Creating 3D effects in CSS isn’t an entirely new concept, but typical approaches use additional elements in the markup and pseudo-elements in the styles to pull it off. Temani Afif applies 3D effects and sliding transitions to a single `` using clever CSS techniques that demonstrate advanced, modern styling practices.
articles.title: Sliding 3D Image Frames In CSS

articles.author: Tan Jin
articles.description: In the ever-evolving realm of web technologies, the integration of AI-powered chatbots has become a defining trend in 2024.  With rapid advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs), chatbots have grown to become pivotal tools adopted across many websites and services. From FAQ bots to live chat support, they can
articles.title: How to Create a React Chatbot – a Step by Step Guide

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: On this week's episode of the podcast, I interview Gary Simon, a developer and designer who started DesignCourse and has published several courses on freeCodeCamp.org over the years. We talk about: Growing up in rural Ohio, marrying young, and stayi...
articles.title: How to Become a Pro Designer in 2024 [Interview with Gary Simon Podcast #123]

articles.author: Ayomide Wilfred
articles.description: A while ago, a client asked me to help them create a special app for generating QR codes so users could receive payments.  What set this app apart was that instead of users entering a URL to generate a QR code, they would initiate a request through the app.
articles.title: How to Build a QR Code Generator for URLs with Node.js, Next.js, and Azure Blob Storage

articles.author: oluwatobi Joshua
articles.description: Databases are an integral component of building applications, whether web, desktop or mobile. They symbolically serve as the mitochondria of the application, as their primary function is to manage data. Database management is a critical skill a developer must possess in building scalable applications that have a high level of
articles.title: How to Optimize Your Database – Optimization Principles and Best Practices

articles.author: Destiny Erhabor
articles.description: Concurrency is the ability of a program to perform multiple tasks simultaneously. It is a crucial aspect of building scalable and responsive systems.  Go's concurrency model is based on the concept of goroutines, lightweight threads that can run multiple functions concurrently, and channels, a built-in communication mechanism for safe
articles.title: How to Handle Concurrency with Goroutines and Channels in Go

articles.author: TAPAS ADHIKARY
articles.description: In this article, we'll explore the question: is TypeScript worth learning? Before we try finding the answer together, let me tell you why I'm suddenly asking this. I come from a Java background where writing code demands that you be type-aware. This means that if you are declaring a string,
articles.title: Should You Learn TypeScript? Pros and Cons of TS Explained

articles.author: Joan Ayebola
articles.description: In programming, objects are fundamental building blocks used to represent real-world entities or concepts. JavaScript, a versatile and popular language, offers various ways to create these objects.  This article dives deep into these methods, equipping you with the knowledge to craft objects tailored to your programming needs. We'll begin
articles.title: How to Create Objects in JavaScript

articles.author: Dionysia Lemonaki
articles.description: Manipulating strings is a fundamental skill in programming. A common task you might encounter when coding in JavaScript is trimming characters from a string. Trimming involves removing specific characters from the beginning and/or end of a string. Th...
articles.title: JS Remove Char from String – How to Trim a Character from a String in JavaScript

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Tezos is a blockchain network that distinguishes itself through a unique self-amending ledger, allowing it to upgrade without the need for hard forks—an approach that promotes continuity and reduces division within the community. Tezos aims to addres...
articles.title: Tezos Blockchain Development Course

articles.author: Daniel Kehoe
articles.description: Python is the most popular first language for programmers on a Mac. Until recently, the language's lack of standard development tooling, plus competing optional-but-essential development tools, meant a rocky start for Python beginners.  To cut through the confusion, I'll show you an up-to-date approach to install Python and set
articles.title: How to Install Python on a Mac
